ygData.subject: Procedures for Adoption of Rules for Tournament
ygData.msgSnippet: Proposed Tournament rules are going to be presented pretty soon in this group. The rules will be voted on by sets.  If a set of rules gets a super majority

Subject: Procedures for Adoption of Rules for Tournament
Message-ID: <9j0kih+dn9r@...>
User-Agent: eGroups-EW/0.82
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Length: 1396
X-Mailer: eGroups Message Poster
From: "Daniel Paul Hightower" <dph_of_rules@...>

Proposed Tournament rules are going to be presented pretty soon in 
this group.

The rules will be voted on by sets.  If a set of rules gets a super 
majority vote of affirmation, that set of rules will become part of 
the tournament rules.  Anything else will prevent the set of rules 
from being adopted.  The adoption process is about making sure the 
gladiator tournament group did not go overboard in making rules too 
strict.

Voting will be done by posting a message to this group.  If you can 
not post messages from this site, send an email to 
gladiator@yahoogroups.com to vote.  No discussion of the rules will be 
allowed (or tolerated) during the voting.  The email should only 
contain a message about voting for or against a set of rules.  
Violators of this rule about no discussion of rules will find their 
potential messages to this group . . . filtered out to prevent any 
discussion of rules after breaking that rule once.  If you feel the 
need to discuss the rules for the tournament, join the gladiator 
tournament group (http://groups.yahoo.com/group/glad-tourny).  This is 
the only time (in the forseeable future) that I am going to walk 
around with my stick in plain view looking to use it.

I am posting this message as a warning for what I expect when we start 
the adoption of rules.  When I post the message about adopting the 
rules, I will repeat the warnings.
